description: The precursor to asparagine is oxaloacetate, which the AAT enzyme converts to aspartate by transferring the amino group from glutamate to oxaloacetate, producing Î±-ketoglutarate and aspartate. The enzyme ASN produces asparagine, AMP, glutamate, and pyrophosphate from aspartate, glutamine, and ATP.  Description adapted from [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asparagine Wikipedia].
title: Asparagine biosynthesis
